results.title: Comrades: a Lanternist's account of the Tolpuddle Martyrs and what became of them
results.creator_credit: Simon Relph, Skresa Productions, Film Four International and Bill Douglas
results.brief_description: An itinerant Lanternist is witness to the rural unrest prevalent in Southern England in the early 1830’s. He arrives in the village of Tolpuddle where the farm labourers form a union and strike when their wages are reduced. Arrested and transported to Australia for seven years, the film follows the fortunes of the five men until their pardon and return to England. Bill Douglas’ only other major film after his autobiographical trilogy, is a similar homage to the oppressed poor. However, in spite of its subject matter, this is less grim. An important work from a great filmmaker. Cameo appearances from Vanessa Redgrave, James Fox, Michael Hordern, John Hargreaves and Robert Stephens.

results.title: Computers: The Friendly Invasion (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Extraordinary computer, graphics and spectacular scenes from the terrific Disney feature “Tron” illustrate dazzling computer applications and introduce students to a fabulous resource. You will learn how people working with computers, can build a better world in the future.

results.title: Computers in the seventies
results.brief_description: This film takes a pre-micro-chip look at computer development to the 1970s providing a short historical background and then examining contemporary computer development in meteorology, records storage, aviation and building design, and medical procedures. Touches on contemporary times with “suspicion”.

results.title: Computers and you
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Journal Films
results.brief_description: In this film a computer display terminal and diagrams are used to explain, in simple terms, how a computer works and what it can do. A clear, visual explanation of how “bits” of information are given and instructions, flow charts, and information storage methods are explained. Suitable for teachers and tertiary level students.

results.title: Computers
results.creator_credit: Bailey Film Productions and Victor and Ellen Landweber
results.brief_description: Describes the major components of a modern digital computer, and explores how the binary number system is useful in computer technology. The computer makes very rapid computations, and stores vast quantities of information.

results.title: Computers
results.creator_credit: Sam Lipski, David Stiven and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”.
Discusses the devleopment and increasing use of computers in Australia. Banks, the TAB, the stock exchange, aviation companies and many government social service departments are extensively computerised. Computers have an invaluable application in medical research and hospital services, and road traffic control. Presents the problem of redundant workers in a computerised community and questions the morality of a National Data Bank.
